decks.notes: This deck revolves around the concept of deploying a fast and aggressive swarm of Human creatures onto the battlefield. It utilizes cards like Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory to quickly and efficiently play out its creatures. The deck includes powerful Human creatures such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Mantis Rider, which can quickly grow in size and deal significant damage. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter adds a control element, preventing opponents from executing their own strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless onslaught of aggressive Human creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create and execute powerful combos. It includes cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, along with tools like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for key pieces. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility in adapting to different game situations, with creatures like Eternal Witness and Fauna Shaman providing ways to retrieve key cards from the graveyard or deck. By assembling the right combination of creatures, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its synergistic interactions.

The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently with low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to apply constant pressure on the opponent, utilizing cards like Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt to chip away at their life total. Key cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear help to maintain momentum and keep the pressure on, while cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide versatility in both dealing damage and protecting your own life total. Overall, the deck aims to win swiftly and decisively through direct damage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting your opponent's hand with spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to maintain board control. Snapcaster Mage is used to flashback important spells and Temur Battle Rage can provide a lethal finisher. Stubborn Denial helps protect your threats and Opt and Thought Scour help maintain card advantage and dig for key cards.

This deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible while also preventing them from gaining life or stabilizing. It utilizes cheap and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and finish the game before they can set up their own strategy. The deck aims to be fast, relentless, and unrelenting in its pursuit of victory through sheer aggression and overwhelming damage output.

This deck focuses on using Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate a large amount of mana by sacrificing artifacts, then using that mana to loop through your deck and bring back key pieces like Scrap Trawler. The goal is to ultimately bring out Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and win the game. The deck includes various artifacts and card draw tools to help dig for combo pieces and ensure the engine runs smoothly. The deck also includes a toolbox of artifacts to interact with the opponent and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a solid win condition, such as using Sphinx's Revelation or Secure the Wastes to generate card advantage or Secure the Wastes to create a large army of tokens. The deck also includes versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Torrential Gearhulk to pressure the opponent and close out the game.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn. It uses ramp spells like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow to accelerate the mana needed for playing Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to fetch multiple mountains. Other cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Hour of Promise provide additional ramp and protection, while Sweltering Suns and Lightning Bolt offer removal and control options. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a critical mass of mountains and trigger Valakut's ability for lethal damage.

The deck focuses on quickly playing creatures and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana, along with powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating to boost creatures, the deck aims to deal heavy damage early on. Synergy between creatures like Steel Overseer and Signal Pest, along with the ability to quickly pump up creatures with Arcbound Ravager, creates a deadly board presence. Overall, the deck emphasizes speed and aggression to secure victory before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager to pump up their power and close out the game quickly. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up and play multiple threats in a single turn. The deck also has access to burn spells like Galvanic Blast to clear the way for its creatures and provide reach to finish off the opponent. The mana base includes a mix of lands that produce colored mana and artifact lands to enable Metalcraft for cards like Galvanic Blast.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly lower your own life total in order to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan. With a combination of cheap removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember, along with efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, this deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total and disrupt their strategy to secure a quick victory. The inclusion of Temur Battle Rage allows for explosive damage output and potential one-shot kills.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Path to Exile, combined with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Ramunap Excavator allows for potential land recursion and further resource advantage. The deck's strategy is to capitalize on early aggression and board presence to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures and using them to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with removal spells. The key strategy is to ramp up mana using cards like Azusa, Courser of Kruphix, and Knight of the Reliquary, allowing for explosive plays and consistent land drops. Collected Company provides card advantage and allows for powerful creature combos to be put into play. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells while also utilizing creatures with flash to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck aims to maintain control of the game through a combination of efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, powerful counterspells like Cryptic Command, and versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Spell Queller. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also enabling powerful land creatures like Celestial Colonnade to provide a win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and versatile creatures. By using cards like Cryptic Command and Spell Queller, the player can disrupt their opponent's game plan while also maintaining board presence with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Geist of Saint Traft. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and tempo through efficient spells like Serum Visions and Lightning Bolt, ultimately out-valuing and outlasting the opponent in order to secure victory.
